item.title: Former Naughty Dog co-president to be inducted into AIAS Hall of Fame
item.content:encoded:
Diego Argüello, Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

January 6, 2026

1 Min Read

Photograph via Naughty Dog

Evan Wells, former co-president of Naughty Dog, will be inducted into the Hall of Fame of the Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences (AIAS).

The AIAS explained Wells' induction will take place at the 29th annual DICE Awards on February 12, 2026. Naughty Dog studio head Neil Druckmann will oversee the induction.

"Naughty Dog was able to create some truly incredible games and leave a lasting mark on the industry because of Evan’s unwavering leadership and the trust he placed in all of us," said Druckmann in the announcement.

Wells joined Naughty Dog back in 1998, working on games like Crash Bandicoot: Warped and Jak and Daxter, before becoming co-president in 2004. He eventually retired in July 2023. 

In a statement shared with the staff at the time of his exit, Wells said he was content with his time at the studio and everything they had accomplished together over the last 25 years.

"Working here has been awe inspiring and I have nothing but gratitude for everything that I’ve been able to learn and be a part of," he wrote.

About the Author

Diego Nicolás Argüello is a freelance journalist and critic from Argentina. Video games helped him to learn English, so now he covers them for places like The New York Times, NPR, Rolling Stone, and more. He also runs Into the Spine, a site dedicated to fostering and supporting new writers, and co-hosted Turnabout Breakdown, a podcast about the Ace Attorney series.
